tagline: Designing innovative thermal systems and optimizing engineering processes through advanced simulation
about: Mechanical Engineering undergraduate with expertise in thermal systems, CFD analysis, and heat transfer applications. I specialize in waste heat recovery systems, HVAC optimization, and advanced simulation techniques using ANSYS and SolidWorks. My research focuses on sustainable energy solutions and thermal management systems.

projects.title: Implementation of an Organic Rankine Cycle as a Waste Heat Recovery System
projects.description: Developed an ORC-based test rig to convert industrial waste heat into electricity using a closed-loop system of pump, evaporator, turbine, and condenser.

projects.title: Transient Thermal Analysis of Braking Systems Using ANSYS
projects.description: Conducted coupled field transient analysis in ANSYS to evaluate thermal performance of ceramic vs. composite brake materials and optimize contact mechanics.

projects.title: Heat Exchanger Performance Optimization using CFD
projects.description: Used ANSYS Fluent to analyze and optimize thermal and flow performance in heat exchangers using parameters like LMTD, pressure drop, and fluid regimes.

projects.title: Hybrid Air-conditioning System for Passenger Vehicles
projects.description: Designed a three-fluid heat exchanger system integrating adsorption refrigeration with exhaust recovery to reduce fuel consumption and improve vehicle HVAC performance.

detailedProjects.title: Implementation of an Organic Rankine Cycle as a Waste Heat Recovery System
detailedProjects.description: Developed an ORC-based test rig to convert industrial waste heat into electricity using a closed-loop system of pump, evaporator, turbine, and condenser. The system efficiently recycles the organic fluid for continuous power generation, achieving significant energy recovery from low-temperature heat sources.

detailedProjects.title: Transient Thermal Analysis of Braking Systems Using ANSYS
detailedProjects.description: Conducted comprehensive coupled field transient analysis in ANSYS to evaluate thermal performance of ceramic vs. composite brake materials. Optimized contact mechanics and simulated braking under varying thermal loads to improve brake system efficiency and safety.

detailedProjects.title: Hybrid Air-conditioning System for Passenger Vehicles
detailedProjects.description: Designed an innovative three-fluid heat exchanger system integrating adsorption refrigeration with exhaust heat recovery. The system significantly reduces fuel consumption while improving vehicle HVAC performance through advanced thermal management techniques.
